context: [1] Leukotriene (LT)B4 is a potent chemotactic mediator that may be involved in several inflammatory reactions in the lungs and airways , . [2] LTB4 is produced predominantly by activated neutrophils, but also by alveolar macrophages and in transcellular reactions involving inflammatory cells and surrounding structural elements . [3] In addition to recruiting neutrophils and causing increased microvascular permeability , LTB4 may stimulate lymphocyte migration in the lung  and constriction of pulmonary blood vessels via indirect mechanisms . [4] In comparison with healthy subjects, the LTB4 levels have been reported to be elevated in EBC collected from subjects with asthma , cystic fibrosis  and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) . [1] The primary aim of the present study was to measure the levels of immunoreactive LTB4 in EBC collected in a human model where a pronounced neutrophilic inflammation was induced . [2] The model involves a standardised exposure of healthy subjects in a pig house for 3â€…h. [3] This challenge results in a two- to three-fold increase in bronchial responsiveness to methacholine, and an associated intense airway neutrophilic inflammation.

The study aims to measure LTB4 levels in a model of induced airway inflammation, further supporting its relevance in asthma pathology.
